page.title: 16Wroxton Village
page.content: Although the village is small and has few children, it still retains its school. There is some council housing but the majority is private. A good number of cottages have undergone restoration and been turned from two into one. The village has become a place where those in management jobs in local commerce and industry have settled. There are some village activities but children often go to nearby Banbury for swimming, ballet etc. The village attracts visitors to the Abbey which is now part of an American University and to its hotel and public houses. The Wroxton Hotel has a fine reputation for the meals it serves. In the centre of the village away from the main Banbury to Stratford-upon-Avon road lies the village pond which is well stocked with fish and ducks.
